title: Edrich Lubbe (rugby union)
text:
Johan Martin Frederick "Edrich" Lubbe (born 29 July 1969) is a South African former <a href="rugby%20union">rugby union</a> player.
Playing career.
Lubbe matriculated at the Robertson High School and represented at the annual <a href="Craven%20Week">Craven Week</a> tournament in 1987. In 1990 he enrolled at the <a href="University%20of%20Stellenbosch">University of Stellenbosch</a> and represented <a href="Maties">Maties</a> on the rugby field. He made his senior provincial debut for in 1991 as the centre partner of <a href="Chester%20Williams">Chester Williams</a>. In 1994 he moved to the and in 1996 to .
Lubbe played two <a href="Test%20match%20%28rugby%20union%29">test matches</a> for the <a href="Springboks">Springboks</a>. His debut was against at <a href="Newlands%20Stadium">Newlands</a> in 1997, following with the first test against the <a href="1997%20British%20Lions%20tour%20to%20South%20Africa">touring British Lions</a> team, also at Newlands.
